result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Jameson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Jameson

records.addlTxt: CK 44069 picked up in office by defendant; remainder of cash bond.

(Cases 22CF517, 21CF1171, 21CM609 are called at 3:49 PM) Defendant Reginald Jameson in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Reginald Jameson.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF517 Count 1- Substantial Battery as Domestic Abuse. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 21CF1171, 21CM609. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 3 years Probation with the following conditions: 12 months jail, all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No acts or threats of violence towards anyone; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; No contact with C.M.; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with recommendations; Maintain absolute sobriety; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders 18 days credit, if revoked.
Plea hearing on July 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 10:31AM: 21CF1171, 21CM609, 22CF517. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Reginald Jameson in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Reginald Jameson.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas in 21CF1171 and 22CF517.
22CF517: Defense filed Motion to Modify the Cash Bond from $5,000 Cash to a $1,000-$2,000 Cash Bond.
Attorney Rivard notes that the Defendant has employment waiting for him and the victim J.J. met with the Victim Witness Office and developed a safety plan. 
State objects noting the Defendant has a criminal history including domestic assault and violation of protection orders. Defendant has 2 open cases with serious charges involving the same victim.
Victim J.J. is present and makes a statement to the Court.
Court denies the motion to modify the bond. Attorney Rivard requests the matters be set for trial. State requests 21CF1171 be set for a 2 Day Jury Trial.
Jury Trial: 8/8/22 and 8/9/22 (Back up Trial)  OR 9/1/22 and 9/2/22 at 9:00 AM (#1 Trial).
STC to be scheduled by Br 1 based on trial date.
Bail/bond hearing on May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Same as Complaint.

1:31 PM cases 21CF1171, 22CF517 called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Reginald Jameson in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Reginald Jameson. 
In 22CF517:Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF517: Defense makes an argument to modify bond (employment may be lost, significant bond amount). Victim J.J makes a statement supporting the bond modification. The State asks the bond remain in place (public safety risk, severity of incident). Court raises concern regarding the lack of a no contact order and references Eau Claire County Pretrial Report. Court denies request but will re-consider the matter after the victim has met with victim/witness regarding a safety plan. Cases referred to Branch 1 to schedule ARGN.
Motion to Modify Bail/Bond
Notice of Assignment of Judge to Defendant. USPS indicates attempted; return to sender; unable to forward.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Francis Rivard

(11:22 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Reginald Jameson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Reginald Jameson.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Court allows victim, J.J. - defendant's wife, to speak.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
